DIALOGUE BEFORE: Mark: I'm getting too old for this job.
RESPONSE TEXT: Mark, you were too old for it a decade ago.

RESPONSE TEXT: I keep telling you we need to get some help. Younger help.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Mark: They don't just grow on trees you know.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Mark: Nobody in the Vault wants to help run this place.
RESPONSE TEXT: Patience, old man. We'll find someone.
SCRIPT NOTES: said with a smile. friendly teasing. / Amused

RESPONSE TEXT: I still think Austin might want it when he grows up. The boy certainly eats enough.
We're almost out of fresh vegetables.
Remind me to drop by Priscilla's lab and pick some up.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Mark: Prissy told me only the turnips are ripe. And nobody likes turnips. Not even Austin.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Mark: Prissy told me only the turnips are ripe. And nobody likes turnips. Not even Austin.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, they'll just have to make do. And stop calling her Prissy. I think she prefers Dr. Penske to that anyday.
Besides, I don't want to listen to Jacob complain again.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Mark: Aw you know she loves it. Makes her feel young.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MarkSummerset: You whippin' up a new batch of pies today? I heard Alexis promise one to Erin, and I know how you hate to disappoint the little ones.
RESPONSE TEXT: Markus William Summerset. Don't you go on thinking you're so clever.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MariaSummerset: Those pies are going to be for Calvin and his crew. Lord knows they could use a treat right now.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MarkSummerset: Hey, you try telling that to Erin and breaking a little girl's heart. I didn't realize my wife was so cold blooded.
RESPONSE TEXT: Mark, I swear. Over forty years of marriage, you need to count your blessings you're still alive.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Why thank you. Mark and I try to keep her tidy. The Sunshine Diner, we call her.

Our menu isn't quite as... exotic as the Commonwealth, but it'll do in a pinch.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: Heavens no, I'd be a wreck. My husband, Mark. He helps me, though mostly with the tasting.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Do you run this place by yourself?
RESPONSE TEXT: Sadly, yes. My husband, Mark... he used to help me, but he's... no longer with us.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Do you run this place by yourself?
RESPONSE TEXT: It used to be easier. Back when I was young we had more supplies than we could count.
Why, my mother taught me some recipes that had ingredients that... Well, I doubt you could find them anywhere anymore.
Since we started trading, we manage well enough, but the variety... Let's just say it's more than a bit lacking.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Do you run this place by yourself?
RESPONSE TEXT: Never... Can you imagine? Born and raised right here in Vault 81.
It was easier back then, you know. Supplies were high and the dangers outside were both severe and unknown.
Poor Gwen didn't know what she was getting into when she accepted the role of Overseer.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Do you run this place by yourself?
RESPONSE TEXT: It weighs on her, I can tell. We need help from the Commonwealth, but a few people... They don't care for it.
Not to mention the state of the Vault. Upkeep's got people working round the clock these days. Even me!
If people are going to be up all night working, they'll need a good meal to keep them going.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Nice place you have here.
RESPONSE TEXT: Why thank you. Mark and I try to keep her tidy. The Sunshine Diner, we call her.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Whatever, lady.

DIALOGUE AFTER: MariaSummerset: If you need any food for the road, or just feeling hungry, you let me know.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Who's Gwen?
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, Gwen's the Overseer, but I could never get used to calling her that. I've known that girl since she was in diapers.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MariaSummerset: If you need any food for the road, or just feeling hungry, you let me know.

RESPONSE TEXT: You must be that new traveler Gwen let in. It's always nice to see a new face around here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Nice place you have here.

RESPONSE TEXT: Good to see that little boy up and about again. Heard you really made an impression on the Vault, too. So what can I get for our new hero?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: Heard you didn't make quite the impression Gwen had hoped for. But she'll handle it. She's a strong woman. Now, what can I get you today?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: Hard to keep my mind on business with that little boy sick. If you need anything, just let me know.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried about a little boy being sick. / Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: Not everyday I get a customer in Power Armor. What can I get you?

RESPONSE TEXT: What can I get you today?

RESPONSE TEXT: If you're heading back out into the Commonwealth, I expect you to do so on a full stomach.

RESPONSE TEXT: Looking for a meal? Or just a quick snack?

Glad the day's over with. These old bones need a good rest.
Good to be out from behind that counter.
Busy day today. Might have to look into requesting more supplies soon.
Let me catch my breath. I ain't as young as I used to be.
Well?

RESPONSE TEXT: Tina, I'm so sorry about Bobby, honey.
